item.description:
Colt State Park (CSP) in Bristol is often referred to as the 'gem' of the RI State Parks System. The entire western border of the park is an open panorama onto Narragansett Bay. Open year round, the park offers four miles of bicycle trails passing along the Bay and through 464 acres of groomed fruit trees, carefully nurtured flowering bushes, and manicured lawns. Rich in history, it proudly displays  ten large playfields,  a historical museum, six picnic groves containing 400+ picnic tables and its' popular open air Chapel-By-The-Sea.

 We will be meeting at 1:00 PM at the statue of Senator Chafee across from the fishing pier parking lot in CSP. There is plenty of additional parking throughout the park.

Colt State Park is located off Hope Street (Route 114) in Bristol, RI. Headed south on RI 114, turn right at the traffic light onto Asylum Road and follow Asylum Road as it bears left toward a rotary. Turn right at the rotary past a kiosk to enter the park and follow the park road (Colt Drive) to the parking lot just past the bridge. The statue of Senator Chaffee will be on the left and the parking lot is on the right.

Below is a MapQuest link to the park entrance:

http://www.mapquest.com/maps?city=Bristol&state=RI&address=299+Asylum+Rd&zipcode=02809-1200&country=US&latitude=41.68701&longitude=-71.287639&geocode=ADDRESS

 

As long as the weather permits, we will be walking this one. If weather turns out to have a crazy snow storm or something, then I will update closer to the date whether this is still going to be happening or not. Hopefully it stays nice!
item.how_to_find_us: In the parking lot next to the statue of Senator Chafee
item.why: Another meetup group just did this and I missed it, so I would like to recreate this for our group. (Hope they don't mind me copying).
item.name: Winter Walk at Colt State Park
